title: Novak Djokovic back in Australia following high-profile visa ban
description: Novak Djokovic is back in Australia, according to a spokesperson with Tennis Australia, nearly a year after his high-profile visa ban from the country over his stance on the Covid-19 vaccination.

title: Key findings from the latest transcripts released by the Jan. 6 panel
description: The January 6 committee released another batch of transcripts Tuesday, including two more of its interviews with blockbuster witness Cassidy Hutchinson and testimony from several other Trump White House officials.

title: Rep.-elect Santos faces growing condemnation for lies as House GOP leadership remains silent
description: GOP Rep.-elect George Santos is facing growing condemnation from House Democrats, some of whom have called on him to step aside, and even from some corners of the GOP, with at least one of his fellow incoming Republicans calling for him to face an ethics investigation. House GOP leadership, however, remains silent over revelations that the New York Republican lied about parts of his biography.

title: Supreme Court says Trump-era border restriction will remain in effect while legal challenges play out
Arizona judge orders Kari Lake to pay fees for election lawsuit but declines to sanction her
description: Three days after a judge rejected Kari Lake's election challenge in the Arizona race for governor, a judge in Maricopa County has ordered her to compensate her opponent, Katie Hobbs, in her capacity as governor-elect and outgoing secretary of state but stopped short of sanctioning Lake for filing the lawsuit.

title: Despite Putin's claims, Ukraine peace talks look unlikely in near future
US Supreme Court says Trump-era border restriction will remain in effect while legal challenges play out
description: The Supreme Court said Tuesday that the controversial Trump-era border restriction known as Title 42 will remain in effect while legal challenges play out, a move that ensures that federal officials will be able to continue to swiftly expel migrants at US borders at least for the next several months.

title: Why Southwest is melting down
Trump tax returns to be released by House panel on Friday
description: The House Ways and Means Committee will release former President Donald Trump's tax returns Friday morning, a source familiar confirmed to CNN.

title: 'Really f--ing hard': Kim Kardashian on challenges of co-parenting with Kanye West
description: In an interview with Angie Martinez on her "IRL" podcast, Kim Kardashian opened up for the first time on the challenges of co-parenting with Kanye West since their divorce.

title: Electric vehicle sales hit a tipping point in 2022
description: Next time you're circling a full parking lot, try to remember what you saw in it just a couple of years ago. Things are different, now. There are a lot more electric vehicles and they aren't just Teslas anymore, either.

title: Hugh Jackman's frenemy dynamic with Ryan Reynolds will bleed into 'Deadpool 3': 'They 'hate each other'
description: Hugh Jackman is sharing details on how his best-known character, grisly mutant X-Man Wolverine, will interact with Ryan Reynolds's wisecracking Deadpool in the upcoming "Deadpool 3."

title: Two miles of US-Mexico border fencing installed as migrants surge around Texas amid Title 42 limbo
description: Since the first length of fencing went up last week along the Mexican border near El Paso, the Texas National Guard has installed over two miles of the barricade and is expected to build more, an agency spokesperson told CNN on Monday.

title: Russia's foreign minister calls on West for maximum restraint 'in order to minimize nuclear risks'
Despite Putin's claims, Ukraine peace talks look unlikely in near future
8-year-old goes viral for incredible dance moves at school concert
description: 8-year-old Jaden Williams was caught on camera tearing up the stage at his elementary school winter concert in Menlo Park, California. CNN affiliate KGO has the story.

title: Arizona Cardinals defensive end J.J. Watt to retire after this NFL season
description: Arizona Cardinals defensive end J.J. Watt will retire after the 2022 season, the three-time NFL Defensive Player of the Year announced on Tuesday. Watt said he played his "last ever" home game this past Sunday, a 19-16 overtime loss to the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

title: Despite Putin's claims, Ukraine peace talks look unlikely in near future
description: As a year dominated by Russia's war on Ukraine draws to a close, Vladimir Putin has made a point of suggesting he is open to peace talks despite evidence to the contrary, with comments that have been roundly dismissed by Kyiv and the West as a ruse at a time when the prospect of negotiations in the near future appears extremely remote.

title: New York's Buffalo reaches 100 inches of snow this season — faster than any previous year
New York's Buffalo reaches 100 inches of snow this season — faster than any previous year
'Tradwives' promote a lifestyle that evokes the 1950s. But their nostalgia is not without controversy
description: On certain corners of the internet, a segment of women is exhibiting a nostalgia for an era it has never known.

title: Convicted leader of plot to kidnap Michigan governor sentenced to 16 years in federal prison
description: A Michigan federal judge sentenced a man convicted of plotting to kidnap Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer to 16 years in prison Tuesday.

title: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck had a blended family and hummingbird-themed Christmas
description: Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez have celebrated their first Christmas as Mr. and Mrs. Affleck.

title: Mental health-related emergency department visits and revisits are on the rise among children, study finds
description: Emergency department visits and revisits in children's hospitals that are related to mental health are "increasing rapidly," a new study suggests.

title: Lake Michigan is covered in 'ice pancakes' due to extreme cold
description: Aerial footage shows ice formations covering Lake Michigan, including a phenomenon only seen if temperatures drop to well below freezing for several days.

title: Beef burger or fish sandwich? These menu labels encourage people to eat less red meat, study shows
description: A little more information on restaurant menus could encourage people to choose meals with a lower climate footprint, according to a new study, which found that adding climate impact labels to foods was an effective strategy to reduce red meat consumption.

title: Russian sausage magnate dies after hotel fall in India
description: Russian sausage magnate-turned-lawmaker Pavel Antov died in India on Saturday after falling from the third floor of his hotel, according to the Indian police.

title: Morrissey says Miley Cyrus wants off a track they've recorded
description: Morrissey isn't spreading holiday cheer.

title: Why eggs have been so expensive this year
description: Several grocery items have gotten more expensive this year. But nothing comes close to the rise in egg prices.

title: Bakhmut is holding 'courageously,' Ukraine says
Late-night hosts on 2022's top stories: From a 'pink trickle' to an Oscars slap
description: There were plenty of news stories in 2022, and through it all late night hosts were there to find humor. Here are some of the top stories of the year and the jokes that were delivered.

title: Piers Morgan's Twitter account posts offensive tweets before disappearing
description: Controversial British television host Piers Morgan's Twitter account sent out explicit, derogatory tweets to his 8.3 million followers Tuesday about the late Queen Elizabeth, singer Ed Sheeran, boxer Andrew Tate and others, before partially disappearing for some users.

title: Why a nearly 20-year-old federal law could be Santos' undoing
description: GOP Rep.-elect George Santos of New York admitted to lying about parts of his resume, including discrepancies in his employment, education history, and other public claims about his biography. CNN political commentator Errol Louis explains the potential legal consequences of his actions.

title: The best hotels to book in 2023
description: The coming year is looking to be a promising one for travel, with restrictions disappearing in many countries, new flight routes launching, and the hotel industry bringing its A game after two years of uncertainty.

title: Why Southwest is melting down
description: A punishing winter storm that dumped multiple feet of snow across much of America led to widespread flight cancellations over the Christmas holiday. By Monday, air travel was more or less back to normal -- unless you booked your holiday travel with Southwest Airlines.

title: Why Southwest is melting down
Crystal Ball 2023: Our commentators' fearless predictions
Crystal Ball 2023: Our commentators' fearless predictions
Oil and Turkish stocks were 2022 market winners. Russia funds and crypto tanked
description: Oil stocks skyrocketed in 2022, so it's no surprise funds that track the energy sector were Wall Street winners this year. But the top fund of the year is a surprising one: It invests in a variety of companies based in Turkey.

title: Arsène Wenger enjoys 'special' surprise return to Emirates Stadium as Arsenal beats West Ham
description: Arsène Wenger's departure from Arsenal as the club's manager in 2018 was bittersweet.

title: Flight carrying family of Iranian soccer legend Ali Daei forced to return
description: The family of an Iranian soccer great was prevented by authorities in the Islamic Republic from leaving the country on Monday.

title: Russia 'bringing in huge amount of reserves' to fight in Kreminna, Ukraine says
Air Force quietly speeds up plans to eliminate spy planes on the front line of America's fentanyl war
description: The US Air Force is moving up its timeline for scrapping a small fleet of surveillance planes used to help take fentanyl pills off the streets, telling National Guard pilots they must fly their aircraft to the boneyard by the end of the month so they can be stripped for parts, according to documents obtained by CNN.

title: Exclusive: $4 gas could return as soon as May, GasBuddy projects
description: Gas prices will probably be significantly cheaper overall next year. Yet the national average could still climb back above the $4-a-gallon threshold as soon as May, according to GasBuddy projections shared exclusively with CNN.

title: Dr. Sanjay Gupta: 6 keys to keeping sharp in 2023
description: At least once a year, we read a sparkling headline about some promising new drug that might help patients with Alzheimer's disease. And at least once a year, we also hear about failed drug trials and reversals of promises that a cure-all is in sight. I wrote a book about how to keep your brain sharp that came out two years ago. Since then, not much has changed in our understanding of how we can preserve our memories, and the lessons remain as relevant as ever. But one thing has become abundantly clearer: Preventing and even treating forms of dementia are largely driven by lifestyle and the choices we make daily. You are not necessarily doomed to whatever fate you think sits stuck in your genes. If there's one fact that's increasingly apparent in scientific circles, it's that our lifestyle choices contribute mightily to our aging process and risk for disease, likely as much -- or perhaps even more -- than our genetics.

title: Respiratory viruses could surge following the holidays, public health experts warn
description: There is growing concern among infectious disease and public health experts that the US could face even more respiratory infections in January.

title: Liverpool agrees deal for Dutch star Cody Gakpo, says PSV
description: Liverpool has agreed to sign forward Cody Gakpo, one of the most coveted young players in Europe, from PSV Eindhoven, the Eredivisie club said on Monday.

title: Broncos name Jerry Rosburg as interim head coach after parting ways with Nathaniel Hackett
description: The Denver Broncos have named Jerry Rosburg as interim head coach, it was announced on Monday, after Nathaniel Hackett was relieved of his duties.

title: What older Americans need to know before undergoing major surgery
description: Larry McMahon is weighing whether to undergo a major surgery. Over the past five years, his back pain has intensified. Physical therapy, muscle relaxants, and injections aren't offering relief.

title: 2022's extraordinary cosmic revelations and moments in space exploration
description: This year, humankind glimpsed the universe in ways that were never before possible, and space missions took unprecedented leaps forward in unraveling the mysteries of the cosmos.

title: Tom Brady: 'I'm going to take my time' before deciding on retirement
description: It's a question that keeps getting asked of the 45-year-old Tom Brady.

title: Taiwan extends mandatory military service period to counter China threat
description: Taiwan will extend the period of mandatory military service for all eligible men from four months to a year amid rising threats from China, President Tsai Ing-wen said at a news conference in Taipei on Tuesday.

title: China adds billions to its 2021 GDP estimate, but its economy is facing a big test this year
description: China's gross domestic product (GDP) for 2021 was over half a trillion yuan more than initially calculated, official data revealed Tuesday. The update comes at a time the world's second-largest economy faces severe strain from an unprecedented wave of Covid infections sweeping the country.

title: From trapped tourists to a 20-hour road trip with strangers, here's how the US winter storm has upended travel for many
description: As millions of holiday travelers piled into cars and flooded into airports with stuffed bags in tow over the weekend, the paralyzing winter storm that has been sweeping across the US threatened to halt or significantly delay many people's journeys.

title: Families rejoice after years of separation as China ends inbound quarantine
description: • China to reopen borders after nearly three years of being closed off to rest of world

title: Families rejoice after years of separation as China ends inbound quarantine
Russia's leader says he's ready to negotiate. One official responds with disbelief, saying Russia 'single-handedly attacked Ukraine and is killing citizens.'
Putin says he's ready to negotiate. Ukraine responds: 'Come back to reality'
Nearly 200 starving Rohingya refugees rescued from stricken vessel
description: They battled hunger and dehydration after the engine of their rickety boat cut out, leaving them adrift in the Andaman Sea for weeks.

title: Southwest Airlines continues canceling flights as New Year holiday approaches
description: Air travelers in the US hoping for clear skies on Tuesday following a disastrous week of weather-related flight cancellations and delays will have to extend their patience a few more days -- particularly if they're flying with Southwest Airlines.

title: Vehicles abandoned in snow as major US winter storm leaves at least 27 dead in one city
description: Days into a deadly winter storm that bedeviled much of the US with freezing temperatures and heavy snowfall, officials in Buffalo, New York, are focused on life-safety measures, plowing through thick snow to get to stranded drivers and to make way for emergency services.

title: Britain weathered political turmoil in 2022. But Brexit remains the elephant in the room
description: The past year has been one of the most tumultuous in modern British politics. The country has gone through three prime ministers, mourned the death of its longest-serving monarch, and is currently in the midst of a cost-of-living crisis that threatens to engulf the Conservative-voting middle classes.

title: Blackouts pose potentially deadly risk to Ukrainians who need power for lifesaving medical devices
description: For Olena Isayenko, the beeping sound her oxygen machine makes when disconnected from power is far scarier than the screeching of the air raid sirens now commonly heard throughout Kyiv.

title: Analysis: Why 2022 was a tough year for Trump and 2023 may not be much better
description: This must feel like the year that won't end for former President Donald Trump, whose actions appear to be catching up with him in public, painful and expensive ways.

title: Ukraine's Zelensky seeks Indian Prime Minister Modi's help with peace plan
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Monday he was relying on India's help to implement a "peace formula" during a phone call with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Heavy snow in Japan kills at least 17, injures dozens
description: Heavy snowfall in northern Japan and other parts of the country killed at least 17 people and injured more than 90 others over the Christmas weekend, authorities said.

title: What attack attempt on Russian base tells retired general
description: Three Russian servicemen were killed after a Ukrainian drone was shot down by air defenses as it approached a military airfield in Saratov Oblast, Russia. Retired Lt. General Mark Hertling explains what this means for the war.

title: Three Russian servicemen killed after drone shot down at air base inside Russia
You can now own Marvel's Infinity Stones. Here's how
description: CNN's Chloe Melas interviews Adam Mirzoeff, President of East Continental Gems, who created Marvel's $25 million dollar Infinity Gauntlet. Mirzoeff has launched a limited collection of Reality Stones which are now on sale.

title: North Korea's record year of missile testing is putting the world on edge
Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa placed in NFL concussion protocol for second time
description: Miami quarterback Tua Tagovailoa is in the NFL's concussion protocol, Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel said at a Monday news conference.

title: Rep.-elect George Santos admits to lying about resume, says he's 'not a criminal'
description: GOP Rep.-elect George Santos of New York admitted in two separate interviews on Monday to lying about parts of his resume but claimed that he hasn't committed any crimes and intends to serve in Congress.

title: North Korea's record year of missile testing is putting the world on edge
description: In 2020, North Korea conducted four missile tests. In 2021, it doubled that number. In 2022, the isolated nation fired more missiles than any other year on record, at one point launching 23 missiles in a single day.

title: Philippines reports at least 8 deaths as rains, floods disrupt Christmas celebrations
description: Philippine authorities on Monday reported at least eight deaths mostly due to floods triggered by heavy rains in the southern provinces, as Christmas celebrations were disrupted for thousands of residents who were forced to evacuate.

title: Putin says he's ready to negotiate. Ukraine responds: 'Come back to reality'
Students go crazy when teacher takes on 8th grader in dance battle
description: Video captures an intense dance battle between 8th graders and their teacher.
